edu.usc.pgroup.goffish.gofs

Interface IPartition

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Collection<ISubgraph>, Iterable<ISubgraph>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ISerializablePartition
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GMLPartition, Partition

    public interface IPartition
extends Collection<ISubgraph>
    A partition represents a subset of the vertices and edges in a graph. A partition is further divided into subgraphs, where each subgraph is a weakly connected component within the partition graph. As a subset of vertices, a partition may contain edges that connect to vertices that are not in this partition. This is dealt with through the notion of remote vertices. A remote vertex is a vertex in the partition which actually represents a vertex owned by another partition. Each subgraph contains mappings for each remote vertex it contains to the partition that owns that remote vertex. A remote vertex is still a proper vertex, in that if queried, the subgraph believes it contains that vertex. However, a remote vertex will only contain links into and out of this partition, it does not contain any links further into the partition that actually owns it. The expected use case is that if a remote vertex is found while traversing links, the partition that owns it will be identified and communicated with, and that partition can supply the vertex with the same id it contains, which is the real vertex.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        long getId()
        Returns the id of this partition.
        Returns:
        the id of this partition

      • isDirected

        boolean isDirected()
        Returns whether this partition contains directed graphs or not.
        Returns:
        true if this partition contains directed graphs, and false if this partition contains undirected graphs

      • containsVertex

        boolean containsVertex(long vertexId)
        Returns whether or not this partition has a subgraph that knows of the specified vertex. The subgraph does not necessarily own the vertex, it may only know of it as a remote vertex which is owned by some other subgraph, but it will still return true if the vertex exists as a remote vertex in this partition. See #ownsVertex(long) to find out if a vertex is owned by this partition.
        Parameters:
        vertexId - the vertex to check subgraphs for
        Returns:
        true if this partition has a subgraph that contains the specified vertex

      • getSubgraphForVertex

        long getSubgraphForVertex(long vertexId)
        Returns the subgraph that contains the given vertex id. Return value is only specified if containsVertex(long) returns true for this vertex. In most implementations this will likely be a scan linear in time by the number of subgraphs.
        Parameters:
        vertexId - the vertex to check subgraphs for
        Returns:
        the subgraph that contains this vertex

      • containsSubgraph

        boolean containsSubgraph(long subgraphId)
        Returns true if this partition contains the specified subgraph.
        Parameters:
        subgraphId - the subgraph to check for
        Returns:
        true if this partition contains the specified subgraph

      • getSubgraph

        ISubgraph getSubgraph(long subgraphId)
        Returns the specified subgraph.
        Parameters:
        subgraphId - the subgraph to retrieve
        Returns:
        the subgraph with the given id
